p: South Africa is one of the countries with the HIV highest prevalence in the world and KwaZulu-Natal (KZN) is the province most affected by the epidemic, with an HIV prevalence of 27.9% in 2012 [ 8]. In 2005, the KZN Department of Health (DOH) initiated an HIV program in the Mbongolwane and Eshowe Health Service Areas, uMlalazi Municipality, KZN province, which included HIV testing, HIV care and ART initiation. In 2011, Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) started supporting this program with large-scale HIV testing, training, mentoring and clinical support in primary care clinics to improve coverage and viral suppression.
